comments.body: It would be useful to have a variable height items test where the item being dragged is as big as the list. Of course tests that scroll will be needed for that.
Please leave a comment with all `// ignore:` explaining why this has to be ignored as per our style guide: https://github.com/flutter/flutter/wiki/Style-guide-for-Flutter-repo#comment-all-ignores

The comment a few lines above ("Rebuild with distinct key objects") is meant to be that comment. I can make it more explicit if it's not clear.

Alternatively, I could create some other key type that doesn't have a const constructor at all, but it seemed a bit heavyweight for this.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +687,691 @@              // Deliberately avoid the const constructor below to ensure keys are
              // distinct objects.
              _Stateful(key: ObjectKey('B')), // ignore:prefer_const_constructors
              _Stateful(key: ObjectKey('C')), // ignore:prefer_const_constructors
              _Stateful(key: ObjectKey('A')), // ignore:prefer_const_constructors

comments.body: You've taught me A LOT about the capabilities of flutter's testing library. Man lol, I need to go back over the docs a bit because a lot of this is new to me.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +277,281 @@                  scrollController: customController,
                  onReorder: (int oldIndex, int newIndex) { },
                  children: const <Widget>[
                    SizedBox(width: 100.0, height: 100.0, child: Text('C'), key: firstBox),
                    SizedBox(width: 100.0, height: 100.0, child: Text('B'), key: secondBox),
